result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Entry into Locked Building, Dwelling or Room [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. STAYED TO 7/6/15 AT 6:30 P.M., to report this date.  Good time credit allowed.  Release for work, school and programming. No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay wil result in a a civil judgment.  Restitution in the amount of $545.00 payable to Emilie R. and Marlon J., first priority.  Joint and several with any convicted coactors; all court costs, fees and surcharges.

Obtain high school diploma, and if that is not possible a GED or HSED.
Maintain full time employment, if in school part time then work part time.  If enroled in school full time then work full time.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No drugs or alcohol.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.
No contact with the victims as specified in the criminal complaint.
Court will allow for expungment on count one, two, and three if the defendant successfully completes all terms of sentencing.

Cooperate with agent.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Breathalyzer tests.

records.addlTxt: Counts two and three.
Count one.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. Good time credit allowed. With release for work, school, and programming. No electronic monitoring.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 3 and to any other sentence.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentences on Counts 2 and 3 and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.


  Conditions of Probation:
-No new law violations reaching the level of a probable casue finding
-Cooperate with agent
-Absolute sobriety; no drugs or alcohol
-Breathalyzer tests
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing
-AODA assessment and treatment
-Participate in a cognitive thinking program
-Obtain high school diploma, and if that is not possible a GED or HSED
-Maintain full-time employment, or if in school part-time then work part-time, or if enrolled in school full-time then work full-time
-No contact with the victims as specified in the criminal complaint


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $545.00 payable to Emilie R. and Marlon J.; first priority; joint and several with any convicted co-actors
All court costs, fees, and assessments


Court will allow for expungment on Counts 1, 2, and 3 if the defendant successfully completes all terms of sentencing.


Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Referral Form

Court stayed the sentence on Count 1 as amended until 07/06/2015 at 6:30pm. Defendant to report by that time on that day.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Report

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charges and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Megan Carmody for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information amending the original charge to COUNT 1:  Theft, PTAC pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a) and 939.05; COUNT 2:  Entry into Locked Building, Dwelling or Room, PTAC pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.15(1), 939.51(3)(a) and 939.05; COUNT 3:  Obstructing/Resisting an Officer pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a).  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information, waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review offer with the defendant; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
FILED, NOTICE OF MOTION STAMPED BY OFFICE OF DA

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marlon J.; Emile R. or the address listed on the criminal complaint.

Defendant Michael Anderson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Michael Anderson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
